intro: Linosyris squamata, commonly known as the scaly linseed plant, is a flowering plant species native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves covered in fine, scale-like hairs. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Linosyris squamata is adapted to arid and rocky environments, making it a hardy and resilient species.
